result.execSummary:
The defendant Elie Bastien was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with KJL or her family.
Lifetime Sex Offender Registry Required.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

charges.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

Sentencing hearing on October 24, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Sentencing hearing on October 24, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

AMENDED CASH BOND - REFERRAL TO BMP
Defendants Cash Bond is Revoked until the defendant has been accepted into BMP.  Once accepted into BMP defendant may be released on the Cash Bond of $5,000 per case (previously posted).
-  If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is Revoked and BMP is removed as condition of bond.
- Defendant shall be subject to the following curfew restrictions: workdays 12:30 a.m. - 2:30 p.m. (in house).  Non-workdays as established by BMP.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with K.J.L. or her family.
- Defendant shall not have any unsupervised contact with any juvenile female.
- Defendant shall not be at or around the Roadstar Inn.
- Defendant shall not use any social media.
- Defendant shall surrender his passport within 24 hours of release to the Clerk of Court's office.
Trial judge - Br 11
Exhibits 1-42 marked and received

Jury question

PM court reporter: Jenny Poirior
Defendant in court with Attorney David E Saperstein.  Tim Helmberger and Cara Throckmorton appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matt Nordquist as court officer. State requests victim be able to remain in courtroom for remainder of trial upon completion of initial testimony. Objection by DE. Motion denied.  Jury enters at 8:53 AM. Oath to final jury given. Jury instructions 50, 103, 000, 148, 55, 58, 300, 145, 115, 140 and 101 read. Openings. KJL duly sworn and testified. Direct by State. DE identified. Exhibit 1 - 40 - screen shots of text messages, marked. State moves exhibits 1-40 into evidence. Objection by DE. Side bar at 10:11 AM. Ends at 10:12 AM. Jury excused for break at 10:13 AM. Jury enters at 10:40 AM. Objection withdrawn by DE. Exhibits 1-40 received. Continued direct. Cross. Side bar at 10:48 AM. Ends at 10:49 AM. Ends at 10:50 AM. Ends at 10:52 AM. Redirect. Brian Shaul duly sworn and testified. Direct by State. Exhibit 41 - Shaul CV, marked and received. Cross. Redirect. Det. Matt Nordquist duly sworn and testified. Direct by State. Side bar at 11:26 AM. Ends at 11:27 AM. Side bar at 11:53 AM. Ends at 11:56 AM. Jury excused for lunch at 11:56 AM. Jury instructions reviewed. Jury enters at 1:28 PM. Continued direct. State requests permission to publish exhibits 1-40, granted. Cross. Liesl Monroy duly sworn and testified. Direct by State. Exhibit 42 - report, marked. Jury excused for break at 2:36 PM. DE renews motion in limine number 2. Argument. Motion denied. Court has colloquy with DE as to testifying. Court finds DE's decision not to testify knowing, intelligent, and voluntary. State renews request for victim to be allowed to be seated in courtroom during closings. Ct grants. State moves to orally amend date in information. Objection by DE. Motion granted. Jury enters at 3:41 PM. State rests. State moves to receive exhibit 42, granted. State moves on record to amend date information, granted. DE rests. Jury instructions. Closings. Alternate juror chosen and released at 4:27 PM. Oath given to bailiff. Jury excused for deliberations at 4:30 PM. Jury has question at 4:50 PM. Answered at 5:01 PM. Jury enters with verdict at 6:13 PM. Jury polled. Jury excused at 6:15 PM. State moves for judgment on the verdict. No objection by DE. Ct accepts vergict and enters judgment of guilt accordingly. SEH to be set. State requesting PSI. State moves to revoke bond. Ct orders PSI. Objection to bond revocation. Bond revoked temporarily until DE is set up with BMP. See BMP form. Other conditions to be added to current conditions: DE cannot leave Dane County. DE shall provide work schedule to BMP. On work days DE is to be in home by 12:30 AM and shall remain at his home between the hours of 12:30 AM and 2:00 PM. ALL OTHER CONDITIONS TO REMAIN THE SAME.
Preliminary jury instructions
Final seating chart. 13 seated

Defendant in court with Attorney David E Saperstein.  Tim Helmberger and Cara Throckmorton appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Det. Matthew Nordquist as court officer. State moves to orally amend wording of count one of the information. No objection. Granted. Prospective jurors enter at 9:41 AM. Oath to prospective panel given at 9:43 AM. 23 jurors sat at 9:54 AM. Voir dire. Individual voir dire. Prospective jurors enter at 11:48 AM. Side bar at 12:04 PM. Ends at 12:04 PM. Side bar at 12:05 PM. Ends at 12:05 PM. Non seated jurors released at 12:27 PM. Parties exercise 5 strikes each. Stricken jurors released at 12:36 PM. Final panel released at 12:37 PM. DE MIL: argument. Motion denied.

MIL: DE: granted. State: 1a- no objection to det. Objection to family member. Ct grants all of MIL 1. 2 and 3 -  court will follwo rules of evidence. 4a - granted. 4b - granted. 4c - granted. 4 - d granted in part. 5 - 11 - granted. Any supplemental MIL due by end of day 8/3/16. Jury will not be able to ask questions. Note taking allowed.
